2013 |accessdate=1 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130914103518/http://bbfc.co.uk/releases/chennai-express-film |archivedate=14 September 2013 }} | country = [[India]] | language = [[Hindi]] | budget = {{INR|link=yes}}115 [[crore]]{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/Collections/movie_collections/budget/?fm=1 |title=Highest Budget Movies All Time |work=[[Box Office India]] |accessdate=18 November 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151004234811/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/Collections/movie_collections/budget/?fm=1 |archivedate=4 October 2015}} | gross = {{INR}}423 crore{{cite news|last=Cain|first=Rob|title=Shah Rukh Khan's 'Fan' Aims To Continue Movie Megastar's Global Hit Streak|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/robcain/2016/03/20/shah-rukh-khans-fan-aims-to-continue-movie-megastars-global-hit-streak/|work=[[Forbes]]|date=20 March 2016|language=en|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171113165918/https://www.forbes.com/sites/robcain/2016/03/20/shah-rukh-khans-fan-aims-to-continue-movie-megastars-global-hit-streak/|archivedate=13 November 2017}} }} '''''Chennai Express''''' ({{IPAc-en|audio=Chennai MW.ogg|tʃ|ɪ|ˈ|n|aɪ}}) is a 2013 Indian [[Hindi]]-language [[action comedy]] film directed by [[Rohit Shetty]] and written by [[Sajid-Farhad]] and Yunus Sajawal. Produced by [[Gauri Khan]], [[Karim Morani]], [[Ronnie Screwvala]] and [[Siddharth Roy Kapur]], the film stars [[Shah Rukh Khan]] as Rahul Mithaiwala, a man who accidentally boards the eponymous train and journeys from [[Mumbai]] to [[Rameswaram]], falling in love with the daughter of a local don, played by [[Deepika Padukone]]. ''Chennai Express'' had [[Nikitin Dheer]] and [[Sathyaraj]] play supporting roles. It was released with subtitles in English, French, Spanish, Arabic, German, Hebrew, Dutch, Turkish and Malay.{{Cite news|url=https://www.news18.com/news/buzz/2-years-of-chennai-express-10-facts-about-the-movie-you-probably-did-not-know-1034433.html|title=2 years of Chennai Express: 10 facts about the movie you probably did not know|work=News18|access-date=26 June 2018}} The first planned collaboration between Khan and Shetty was a remake of ''[[Angoor (1982 film)|Angoor]]'' (1982). The script of ''Chennai Express'', which was initially written as a backup project for Khan, was chosen instead. Conceived as a "commercial" [[Romance film|romance]], the film was originally titled ''Ready Steady Po''. Filming began in [[Mehboob Studio]] in October 2012 and was completed by May 2013. A large part of the film was set in [[Ooty]], for which sets were constructed in Wai. The soundtrack for ''Chennai Express'' was composed by [[Vishal–Shekhar]], with the background score being composed by Amar Mohile. [[UTV Motion Pictures]] acquired the distribution rights of the film. ''Chennai Express'' was released theatrically in overseas markets on 8 August 2013 and a day later in India. The film received mixed reviews from critics. Regardless, it broke several box office records in India and abroad, becoming the quickest film to collect {{INRConvert|1|b}} net domestically. The film surpassed ''[[3 Idiots]]'' to become the [[List of highest-grossing Indian films|highest-grossing Bollywood film]] worldwide at that point. As of March 2018, it is the eleventh-highest-grossing Bollywood film worldwide. ''Chennai Express'' is also the first Bollywood film which was released on the same day in India and Peru. ==Plot== Rahul Mithaiwala is an orphaned bachelor living in [[Mumbai]]. Raised by his grandparents from the age of eight, Rahul's grandfather owns a chain of confectionery shops. Before his grandfather's 100th-birthday celebration, two of Rahul's friends invite him to accompany them on a vacation in [[Goa]], which he accepts. Rahul's grandfather dies on the eve of the celebration, just when he witnesses [[Sachin Tendulkar]] on TV in a [[cricket]] match get [[Dismissal (cricket)|dismissed]] on his 99th [[Run (cricket)|run]]. His grandmother tells Rahul that his grandfather wanted his ashes to be divided into two parts{{mdash}}one of each to be immersed in the [[Ganges|Ganga]] and [[Rameswaram]]. She asks Rahul to take the ashes to Rameswaram and disperse them. Reluctantly, he accepts her request but is also eager to attend the Goa trip. Rahul and his friends plan to dump the ashes at Goa but his grandmother wants to see him off, forcing Rahul to travel by train. He books a single ticket on the ''Chennai Express'', planning to meet his friends along the way, at [[Kalyan Junction railway station|Kalyan Junction station]]. However, Rahul forgets to take the ashes, and he almost misses the train when he returns to collect them. As he tries to leave the train, he notices a young woman running to board it. He helps her and four other people board the moving train, but the train leaves the station before he can get off. Rahul tries to flirt with the woman, who starts communicating by singing parodies of [[Bollywood song and dance|Hindi film songs]], and explains that the four men are trying to kidnap her. Rahul lends her his mobile phone so that she can contact her friends, but the men with her grab it and throw it from the train. Rahul is annoyed, but says nothing because the men are carrying weapons. Rahul tells the Travelling Ticket Examiner about them, but they push the inspector into a river below a bridge. Panicked, Rahul learns that the men are her cousins, and that her name is Meenalochni "Meena" Azhagusundaram. She is fleeing from a [[forced marriage]] to ruffian Tangaballi. Her father, Durgeshwara Azhagusundaram is a powerful headman of the local mafia in [[Tamil Nadu]]. [[File:Chennai Express screenshot.jpg|thumb|250px|Rahul ([[Shahrukh Khan]]) helps Meenamma ([[Deepika Padukone]]) board the train, a spoof of the famous train scene in the 1995 film ''[[Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge]]''{{cite web | url=http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukones-ddlj-moment-in-chennai-express/1130571/ | title=Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone's DDLJ moment in Chennai Express | work=The Indian Express | date=18 June 2013 | accessdate=25 February 2014 | deadurl=no | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140304025402/http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukones-ddlj-moment-in-chennai-express/1130571/ | archivedate=4 March 2014 | df=dmy-all }}]] Meena takes Rahul to her father and introduces him as her lover. Tangaballi challenges Rahul to a duel that Rahul unknowingly accepts, due to his lack of knowledge in [[Tamil language|Tamil]]. On the night of the duel, Rahul escapes with the help of a local policeman, Shamsher, but he ends up on a ship with Sri Lankan terrorists and smugglers. A gun battle ensues between the police force and the terrorists. When the police officers investigate and take Rahul into custody, he tells his story and ends up back in Komban. Terrified and once again surrounded by Azhagusundaram's sickle-wielding henchmen, Rahul pretends to take Meena hostage and escapes with her in her father's car, battling Azhagasundaram's men. When the car breaks down, Rahul and Meena quarrel and part ways. Rahul, not knowing which way to go, returns to Meena, who takes him to the Vidhamba village. Meena tells the villagers that they are a married couple who needs protection and rest, to which the villagers agree. Meena then realises that she has fallen in love with Rahul. When Rahul plans to sneak away, she argues, not wanting to earn the villagers' distrust. Tangaballi catches Rahul as he tries to leave, but the villagers help them escape again. Meena persuades Rahul to disperse his grandfather's ashes and travels with him to Rameswaram, where they complete the rites. On their way back, Rahul realises that he has fallen in love with Meena, and does not tell her where they are going. He takes Meena back to her father and tries to make him understand and honour his daughter's wish. He also tells Meena that he loves her. Rahul tells Tangaballi and his goons that he is ready for the fight this time. In the fight that follows, Rahul is severely injured but emerges victorious. Azhagusundaram and Tangaballi reform, accepting that the love of a common man like Rahul is bigger than their physical ability and political influence. Azhagusundaram allows Rahul to marry Meena. Rahul then leaves a message that love knows no regional or language barriers and that with a strong heart, there is no limit to what the common man can achieve. ==Cast== {{colbegin}} * [[Deepika Padukone]] as Meenalochni "Meena" Azhagusundaram * [[Shah Rukh Khan]] as Rahul Mithaiwala * [[Nikitin Dheer]] as Tangaballi{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Chennai-Express-has-made-me-a-better-actor-Nikitin-Dheer/articleshow/22510795.cms?|title='Chennai Express' has made me a better actor: Nikitin Dheer|publisher=''[[The Times of India]]''|date=12 September 2013|accessdate=28 December 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170906184629/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Chennai-Express-has-made-me-a-better-actor-Nikitin-Dheer/articleshow/22510795.cms|archivedate=6 September 2017|df=dmy-all}} * [[Sathyaraj]] as Durgeshwara Azhagusundaram{{cite web |url=http://www.koimoi.com/most-popular/introducing-the-characters-of-chennai-express/ |title=Introducing The Characters of Chennai Express |publisher=[[Koimoi]] |date=2 July 2013 |accessdate=2 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130706001518/http://www.koimoi.com/most-popular/introducing-the-characters-of-chennai-express/ |archivedate=6 July 2013 |df=dmy-all }} * [[Mukesh Tiwari]] as Inspector Shamsher{{cite web|url=http://movies.ndtv.com/movie-reviews/chennai-express-movie-review-857|title=Chennai Express movie review|publisher=[[NDTV]]|author=Saibal Chatterjee|date=8 August 2013|accessdate=28 December 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131108235213/http://movies.ndtv.com/movie-reviews/chennai-express-movie-review-857|archivedate=8 November 2013|df=dmy-all}} * [[Kamini Kaushal]] as Rahul's grandmother * [[Puvisha Manoharan]] as Meenalochni's cousin * [[Lekh Tandon]] as Rahul's grandfather * [[Mohan Raman]] as Village Priest * [[Yogi Babu]] as Sri Lankan smuggler * [[Jasper (actor)|Jasper]] as Henchman * [[King Kong (actor)|King Kong]] as Passerby * [[Jimmy Moses]] as Truck Driver * [[Delhi Ganesh]] * Rakesh Kukreti as Bobby, Rahul's friend{{Cite web |url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movie/chennai-express/cast/ |title=Bollywood Hungama Chennai Express(2013) |date=1 January 2013 |publisher=[[Bollywood Hungama]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130712015825/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/moviemicro/cast/id/570145/Chennai%20Express |archive-date=12 July 2013 |dead-url=no |access-date=25 July 2013 |df=dmy-all}} * [[Priyamani]] ([[item number]] "1 2 3 4 Get on the Dance Floor"){{cite web|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2013/priyamani-salman-shahrukh-khan-movies-127348.html|author=Ramchander|title=Priyamani eyes for Salman and Shahrukh Khan movies|publisher=[[One India]]|accessdate=2013-12-28|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131218021530/http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2013/priyamani-salman-shahrukh-khan-movies-127348.html|archivedate=18 December 2013|df=dmy-all|date=2013-12-16}}{{cite web|url=https://www.ibtimes.co.in/chennai-express-priyamanis-item-song-with-shahrukh-khan-to-be-shot-again-449688|title='Chennai Express': Priyamani's Item Song with Shahrukh Khan to be Shot Again!|author=IB Times Staff Reporter|publisher=|date=2013-03-24}}{{cite web|url=http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/shah-rukh-khans-latkas-jhatkas-in-chennai-express-item-number/1132090/|title=Shah Rukh Khan's latkas jhatkas in Chennai Express item number - Indian Express|website=archive.indianexpress.com}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bollywoodlife.com/news-gossip/south-actor-priyamani-is-excited-about-her-item-number-in-shahrukh-khans-chennai-express/|title=South actor Priyamani is excited about her item number in Shahrukh Khan's Chennai Express! - Bollywoodlife.com|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=https://gulfnews.com/life-style/celebrity/southern-spice-the-southern-girl-in-srk-s-chennai-1.1215017|title=Southern Spice: The Southern girl in SRK's "Chennai"|first=Mythily|last=Ramachandran|date=1 August 2013|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bollywoodlife.com/news-gossip/chennai-express-song-one-two-three-four-what-exactly-is-sharukh-khan-up-to/|title=Chennai Express song One two three four: What exactly is Shahrukh Khan up to? - Bollywoodlife.com|publisher=}} {{colend}} ==Production== ===Development and casting=== [[Mayank]] and [[Rohit Shetty]] had originally planned to team up with [[Shah Rukh Khan]] for a remake of the 1982 film, ''[[Angoor (1982 film)|Angoor]]''. After the 2011 blockbuster ''[[Singham]]'', Shetty had begun writing the script of the film but left it half-finished. The script of ''Chennai Express'' was ready for Khan as a back-up, because of the difficulty of obtaining the actor's filming dates.{{cite web |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/srk-says-yes-to-rohit-shettys-chennai-express-602786 |publisher=[[NDTV]] |title=SRK says yes to Rohit Shetty's Chennai Express |date=9 December 2011 |accessdate=19 January 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150113190321/http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/srk-says-yes-to-rohit-shettys-chennai-express-602786 |archivedate=13 January 2015 |df=dmy-all }} Upon reading the script, Khan liked the idea and agreed to star in it before the ''Angoor'' remake, causing ''Angoor''{{'s}} remake to be postponed. Shetty said the film is "a hard-core commercial film with a romantic angle. The story is about this man's travel from Mumbai to Rameshwaram and what happens during the journey."{{cite web |url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/celebrities/features/type/view/id/2889 |title=I'm making Chennai Express with SRK – Rohit Shetty |publisher=[[Bollywood Hungama]] |date=16 November 2011 |accessdate=5 March 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120207233235/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/celebrities/features/type/view/id/2889 |archivedate=7 February 2012 |df=dmy-all }} About 68 minutes of footage were enhanced with [[Computer-generated imagery|CGI]] by [[Reliance MediaWorks]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/slideshow/type/view/id/1518|title=68 minutes of CGI to augment narrative|author=Philip Bode|publisher=Bollywood Hungama|date=5 September 2013|accessdate=27 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150113185544/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/movies/slideshow/type/view/id/1518|archivedate=13 January 2015|df=dmy-all}} [[File:SRK at CE promotion.jpg|thumb|upright|left|''Chennai Express'' was initially written as a backup project for Khan (pictured).]] Khan was the first actor to be approached with the script and was the first lead actor to be signed for the film. Rohit Shetty stated that despite the title, Khan would not play a South Indian in the film. The casting of the lead heroine was the subject of much press speculation; [[Kareena Kapoor]], [[Asin]] and [[Deepika Padukone]] were rumoured to be involved.{{cite web |url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/news/2012/shahrukh-khan-beefy-muscles-chennai-express-190312.html |title=Shahrukh Khan develops Beefy Muscles for Chennai Express |author=Nabanita |publisher=[[One India]] |date=19 March 2012 |accessdate=1 January 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131002100837/http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/news/2012/shahrukh-khan-beefy-muscles-chennai-express-190312.html |archivedate=2 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }} Shetty denied those rumours, stating that the cast would be finalised in April 2012, and that he was going to cast an established actress in the role.{{cite web |url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/news/2012/shahrukh-khan-chennai-express-lady-mystery-210212.html |title=Rohit Shetty Furious |publisher=[[One India]] |author=Nabanita |date=21 February 2011 |accessdate=5 March 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131002101206/http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/news/2012/shahrukh-khan-chennai-express-lady-mystery-210212.html |archivedate=2 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }} In October 2012, it was confirmed that [[Deepika Padukone]] had been signed to play the female lead opposite Khan, and photographs showing Padukone and Khan shooting were released.{{cite web|url=https://www.livemint.com/Leisure/j5ue1kjP0Dus3qKfDCMf6M/Deepika-Padukone-This-time-I-bullied-him-a-lot.html|title=I bullied Shah Rukh Khan a lot: Deepika Padukone on Chennai Express|first=Udita|last=Jhunjhunwala|date=7 August 2013|publisher=|accessdate=26 June 2018}} This was Padukone's second film opposite Khan, with whom she made her Bollywood debut in the 2007 blockbuster ''[[Om Shanti Om]]''.{{cite web |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/photogallery/7579-7.html |title=StarGaze: SRK, Deepika Padukone on the sets of 'Chennai Express' and more |publisher=[[CNN-IBN]] |date=6 October 2012 |accessdate=14 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131009233650/http://ibnlive.in.com/photogallery/7579-7.html |archivedate=9 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web|agency=[[Press Trust of India]]|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/chennai-express-deepika-to-star-with-shah-rukh/281584-8-66.html|title=Deepika to star with Shah Rukh|publisher=[[CNN-IBN]]|date=12 August 2012|accessdate=14 July 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131009233704/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/chennai-express-deepika-to-star-with-shah-rukh/281584-8-66.html|archivedate=9 October 2013|df=dmy-all}} Starting with this film, which was released on Women's Day, Khan wished to have the name of his female co-star appear above his own in the credits.{{cite news|title=Women's Day: It's ladies first for Shah Rukh Khan|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Womens-Day-Its-ladies-first-for-Shah-Rukh-Khan/articleshow/18843611.cms|newspaper=The Times of India|author=Thakkar, Mehul S|date=17 March 2013|accessdate=30 August 2014|quote=Starting with his upcoming film Chennai Express, the credit rolls will not feature his name first, but that of his leading actress.|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150311235943/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Womens-Day-Its-ladies-first-for-Shah-Rukh-Khan/articleshow/18843611.cms|archivedate=11 March 2015|df=dmy-all}} [[Sathyaraj]] was cast to play the role of Padukone's character's father, making his debut in Bollywood.{{cite web |url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2012/sathyaraj-deepika-padukone-chennai-express-099610.html |author=Ramchander |title=Sathyaraj turns Deepika Padukone's Father in Chennai Express? |publisher=[[One India]] |date=21 November 2012 |accessdate=2 February 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121115082509/http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2012/sathyaraj-deepika-padukone-chennai-express-099610.html |archivedate=15 November 2012 |df=dmy-all }} Actress [[Priyamani]] was signed in January 2013 for an item number in the film.{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2013/priyamani-booty-shahrukh-khan-chennai-express-103162.html|title=Priyamani to shake her booty for Shahrukh in Chennai Express!|publisher=[[Oneindia.com|Oneindia Entertainment]]|author=Ramchander|date=3 February 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130518124737/http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2013/priyamani-booty-shahrukh-khan-chennai-express-103162.html|archivedate=18 May 2013|df=dmy-all}} Other personalities from [[Tamil cinema]], including [[Delhi Ganesh]] and [[Mohan Raman]], appear in minor roles.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/king-can/article4720707.ece|title=King Can|date=16 May 2013|author=Meena Venkatraman|publisher=''[[The Hindu]]''|accessdate=29 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180205101233/http://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/king-can/article4720707.ece|archivedate=5 February 2018|df=dmy-all|newspaper=The Hindu}} The film was initially titled as ''Ready Steady Po''. However, to emphasis on the connection with South India, the film was retitled as ''Chennai Express'' with the planned title used as the tagline.{{cite web |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/photo-features/chennai-express-lesser-known-facts/chennai-express-lesser-known-facts/photostory/39611464.cms |title=Chennai Express : Lesser Known Facts |accessdate=2018-02-02 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180205101233/https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/photo-features/chennai-express-lesser-known-facts/chennai-express-lesser-known-facts/photostory/39611464.cms |archivedate=5 February 2018 |df=dmy-all }} ===Filming and post-production=== [[File:Munnar hillstation kerala.jpg|thumb|right|260px|alt=|The [[Munnar]] Hill station in Kerala, one of the film's major locations]] Filming on the project began at [[Mehboob Studio]] in Mumbai on 5 October 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiatvnews.com/entertainment/bollywood/shah-rukh-khan-salman-khan-together-mehboob-studio-9102.html|title=Shah Rukh-Salman spotted together at Mehboob studio|date=8 August 2013|publisher=''[[India TV|India TV News]]''|accessdate=27 December 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130826215403/http://www.indiatvnews.com/entertainment/bollywood/shah-rukh-khan-salman-khan-together-mehboob-studio-9102.html|archivedate=26 August 2013|df=dmy-all}} additional filming was done at [[Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus railway station]] with a minimal crew.{{cite web|url=http://businessofcinema.com/bollywood_news/chennai-express-shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukone-bring-back-ddlj-memories/54345|title=Chennai Express: Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone Bring Back 'DDLJ' Memories|publisher=Businessofcinema|date=27 November 2012|accessdate=29 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304132119/http://businessofcinema.com/bollywood_news/chennai-express-shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukone-bring-back-ddlj-memories/54345|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=dmy-all}} Stills of the lead actor were unofficially released in mid-October 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/srks-working-sunday-for-chennai-express-491061.html|title=SRK's working Sunday for Chennai Express!|publisher=[[Firstpost]]|author=Rubina A. Khan|date=15 October 2012|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121219091803/http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/srks-working-sunday-for-chennai-express-491061.html|archivedate=19 December 2012|df=dmy-all}} In November 2012, the cast and crew went to Goa to begin filming the scenes set there.{{cite web|url=http://businessofcinema.com/bollywood_news/chennai-express-shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukone-shoot-at-iconic-dudhsagar-falls/54453|author=Simran Chopra|date=12 August 2012|title=Chennai Express: Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone Shoot At Iconic Dudhsagar Falls|publisher=Business of Cinema|accessdate=26 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150128114116/http://businessofcinema.com/bollywood_news/chennai-express-shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukone-shoot-at-iconic-dudhsagar-falls/54453|archivedate=28 January 2015|df=dmy-all}} [[Vasco da Gama railway station|Vasco Da Gama Railway Station]] was used to portray as [[Kalyan Junction railway station]]. A romantic scene on board a train passing next to [[Dudhsagar Falls]] was also shot.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bollywood/news/a443898/shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukone-shoot-waterfall-sequence.html|title=Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone shoot waterfall sequence|work=Digital Spy|author=Steven Baker|date=8 December 2012|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130516030242/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/bollywood/news/a443898/shah-rukh-khan-deepika-padukone-shoot-waterfall-sequence.html|archivedate=16 May 2013|df=dmy-all}} In December 2012, the crew went to [[Jakarta]] to film certain scenes.{{cite web|url=http://www.glamsham.com/movies/scoops/12/dec/08-news-shahrukh-khan-leaves-for-jakarta-with-chennai-express-team-111209.asp|title=Shahrukh Khan leaves for Jakarta with Chennai Express team|publisher=Glamsham|date=8 December 2012|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121230134507/http://glamsham.com/movies/scoops/12/dec/08-news-shahrukh-khan-leaves-for-jakarta-with-chennai-express-team-111209.asp|archivedate=30 December 2012|df=dmy-all}} In January 2013, a shoot was supposedly scheduled to take place in [[Ooty]], but since [[Shah Rukh Khan|Khan]] felt that Ooty was too far from Mumbai, several locations from Ooty were reconstructed on the outskirts of [[Panchgani]] in [[Wai, Maharashtra|Wai]] by the art director Narendra Ruharikar. It took over 40 days and {{INR}} 15 million to build the required sets.{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/1816947/report-shah-rukh-khan-brings-ooty-to-wai|title=Shah Rukh Khan brings Ooty to Wai!|work=Daily News and Analysis|author=Upala KBR|date=30 March 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130404125858/http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/1816947/report-shah-rukh-khan-brings-ooty-to-wai|archivedate=4 April 2013|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Shah-Rukh-Khan-Deepika-Padukone-flaunt-lungi-for-Chennai-Express/Article1-983924.aspx|title=Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone flaunt lungi for Chennai Express|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|author=[[Bollywood Hungama]]|date=2 January 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130303101949/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Shah-Rukh-Khan-Deepika-Padukone-flaunt-lungi-for-Chennai-Express/Article1-983924.aspx|archivedate=3 March 2013|df=dmy-all}} Filming in Wai took the entire month of March 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.koimoi.com/most-popular/team-chennai-express-wraps-up-wai-schedule/|title=Team 'Chennai Express' Wraps Up Wai Schedule|publisher=Koimoi|date=1 April 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130518022302/http://www.koimoi.com/most-popular/team-chennai-express-wraps-up-wai-schedule/|archivedate=18 May 2013|df=dmy-all}} A 10-day shooting schedule in [[Munnar]], Kerala, began in mid-April 2013; scenes were filmed at [[Devikulam|Devikulam Lake]], [[Meesapulimala]], Wagavara and Kannimala.{{cite web|url=http://newindianexpress.com/states/kerala/King-Khan-in-Munnar-for-%E2%80%98Chennai-Express%E2%80%99-shooting/2013/04/14/article1544431.ece|title=King Khan in Munnar for 'Chennai Express' shooting|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|date=30 April 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130520214516/http://newindianexpress.com/states/kerala/King-Khan-in-Munnar-for-%E2%80%98Chennai-Express%E2%80%99-shooting/2013/04/14/article1544431.ece|archivedate=20 May 2013|df=dmy-all}} Filming was stopped for several days because of heavy rainfall, resulting in the schedule being slightly extended until end of the same month.{{cite web|url=http://newindianexpress.com/entertainment/hindi/Munnar-Diaries/2013/04/30/article1567446.ece|title=Munnar Diaries|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|author=Awasthy K|date=30 April 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130514113528/http://newindianexpress.com/entertainment/hindi/Munnar-Diaries/2013/04/30/article1567446.ece|archivedate=14 May 2013|df=dmy-all}} A press conference was held in Munnar.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?x-yt-cl=84503534&v=AP3x-5oK7_A&x-yt-ts=1421914688|title=Shahrukh Khan not to act in Malayalam cinema|publisher=''[[Asianet News]]''|accessdate=26 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160311074059/https://www.youtube.com/watch?x-yt-cl=84503534&v=AP3x-5oK7_A&x-yt-ts=1421914688|archivedate=11 March 2016|df=dmy-all}} In May 2013, scenes were filmed in [[North Goa]].{{cite web|url=http://www.filmfare.com/news/salman-and-srk-together-in-goa-3187.html|title=Salman and SRK together in Goa|publisher=[[Filmfare]]|date=20 May 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130524095949/http://www.filmfare.com/news/salman-and-srk-together-in-goa-3187.html|archivedate=24 May 2013|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/news/2013/new-pics-shahrukh-khan-deepika-padukone-chennai-express-110459.html|title=New Pictures: Shahrukh Khan, Deepika Padukone on Chennai Express sets|publisher=Oneindia Entertainment|author=Puri|date=24 May 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130608041256/http://entertainment.oneindia.in/bollywood/news/2013/new-pics-shahrukh-khan-deepika-padukone-chennai-express-110459.html|archivedate=8 June 2013|df=dmy-all}} [[Deepika Padukone|Padukone]] finished shooting on 25 May 2013.{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-05-26/news-interviews/39537371_1_chennai-express-rohit-shetty-om-shanti-om |title=Deepika Padukone wraps up 'Chennai Express' shoot|work=[[The Times of India]]|author=Akshata Shetty|date=27 April 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013}} Khan flew to [[Hyderabad, India|Hyderabad]] in May 2013 to film his remaining scenes.{{cite web|title=Karan Johar Picks Aamir Khan Over SRK at Birthday Bash!|url=http://businessofcinema.com/news/karan-johar-picks-aamir-khan-over-srk-at-birthday-bash/75806|publisher=Business of Cinema|date=27 May 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131023061042/http://businessofcinema.com/news/karan-johar-picks-aamir-khan-over-srk-at-birthday-bash/75806|archivedate=23 October 2013|df=dmy-all}} The film has several Tamil dialogues, but to retain context no subtitles were used.{{cite web|agency=[[Indo-Asian News Service|IANS]] |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-08-10/news-interviews/41268462_1_chennai-express-film-rohit-shetty |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130811101140/http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-08-10/news-interviews/41268462_1_chennai-express-film-rohit-shetty |dead-url=yes |archive-date=11 August 2013 |title=Will wait for 3–4 days to count 'Chennai Express' collections: Shah Rukh Khan|work=The Times of India |date=10 August 2013 |accessdate=15 August 2013}} ''Chennai Express'' was produced by [[Gauri Khan]], [[Karim Morani]], [[Ronnie Screwvala]] and [[Siddharth Roy Kapur]] under the [[Red Chillies Entertainment]] banner. It was released internationally by [[UTV Motion Pictures]]. ==Soundtrack== {{Infobox album | name = Chennai Express | type = Soundtrack | artist = [[Vishal-Shekhar]] | cover = | alt = | released = {{Start date|df=yes|2013|07|01}} | recorded = 2012–2013 | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Film soundtrack|Feature film soundtrack]] | length = 39:34 | language = [[Hindi]] | label = [[Super Cassettes soundtrack | single1 = [[Lungi Dance]] | single1date = 13 July 2013 }} }} The score of ''Chennai Express'' was composed by Amar Mohile;{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/music/news/We-are-living-in-an-age-of-fast-and-furious-change-Joi/articleshow/26025886.cms|title=We are living in an age of fast and furious change: Joi|publisher=[[The Times of India]]|date=19 November 2013|accessdate=29 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180205101233/https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/music/news/We-are-living-in-an-age-of-fast-and-furious-change-Joi/articleshow/26025886.cms|archivedate=5 February 2018|df=dmy-all}} the songs were composed by the duo [[Vishal-Shekhar]],{{cite news|url=http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/chennai-express-why-vishal-dadlani-is-wrong-about-yo-yo-honey-singh-1016965.html|title=Chennai Express: Why Vishal Dadlani is wrong about Yo Yo Honey Singh|publisher=''[[Firstpost]]''|author=Apoorva Dutt|date=7 August 2013|accessdate=29 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140408041423/http://www.firstpost.com/bollywood/chennai-express-why-vishal-dadlani-is-wrong-about-yo-yo-honey-singh-1016965.html|archivedate=8 April 2014|df=dmy-all}} and the lyrics were written by [[Amitabh Bhattacharya]] and [[Yo Yo Honey Singh]].{{cite web|url=http://www.livemint.com/Leisure/dx2g4uk1WnzBm6b8Q0KuoK/Amit-Trivedi--Amitabh-Bhattacharya--Double-impact.html|title=Amit Trivedi & Amitabh Bhattacharya|publisher=[[Livemint]]|author=Udita Jhunjhunwala|date=29 June 2013|accessdate=29 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140505010322/http://www.livemint.com/Leisure/dx2g4uk1WnzBm6b8Q0KuoK/Amit-Trivedi--Amitabh-Bhattacharya--Double-impact.html|archivedate=5 May 2014|df=dmy-all}} Recording of the songs began in late October 2012. The track "Ready Steady Po" was recorded in November 2012 by the music's composers. Several sources said that the director and actor were unsatisfied with the score. The director was reportedly asked to plan for a different musical composition.{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Shah-Rukh-Khan-not-happy-with-music-of-Chennai-Express/Article1-1048404.aspx|title=Shah Rukh Khan not happy with music of Chennai Express|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|author=Dibyojyoti Baksi|date=22 April 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510082109/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Shah-Rukh-Khan-not-happy-with-music-of-Chennai-Express/Article1-1048404.aspx|archivedate=10 May 2013|df=dmy-all}} However, the composers denied these rumours.{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-04-27/news-and-interviews/38861080_1_vishal-dadlani-chennai-express-shahrukh-khan |title=Not asked to re-work 'Chennai Express' music: Vishal-Shekhar|work=[[The Times of India]]|author=Akshata Shetty|date=27 April 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013}} In mid-April 2013, singer [[S. P. Balasubrahmanyam]] recorded the title track for the film, marking his return to Bollywood for playback after an absence of fifteen years. He said the song celebrated the spirit of togetherness. Initially, Balasubrahmanyam was apprehensive, but chose to sing due to the content and leads of the film. The song "1 2 3 4 get on the dance floor" was released as a promotional single on [[World Music Day]]. On 27 June 2013, the video promo of the song "Titli" was released,{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1mIU_6Niqrk|title=Titli Chennai Express Official Video|publisher=[[Super Cassettes Industries T-Series|T-Series]]|date=27 June 2013|accessdate=30 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150514172054/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1mIU_6Niqrk|archivedate=14 May 2015|df=dmy-all}} and on 11 July 2013, the promo video of "Kashmir Main Tu Kanyakumari" was released.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v0exwjcYU5U|title=Kashmir Main Tu Kanyakumari: Chennai Express song|publisher=T-Series|date=11 July 2013|accessdate=30 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131221115824/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v0exwjcYU5U|archivedate=21 December 2013|df=dmy-all}} On 19 July 2013, [[Super Cassettes Industries T-Series|T-Series]] uploaded a song to its official channel on YouTube; sung by [[Honey Singh]]. The song was titled "[[Lungi Dance]] – The 'Thalaivar(r)' Tribute" in honour of the film actor [[Rajinikanth]].{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D8Br5HLmP1c |title=The Thalaivar Tribute (Lungi Dance) Feat. Yo Yo Honey Singh |publisher=T-Series |date=23 July 2013 |accessdate=23 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130920041445/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D8Br5HLmP1c |archivedate=20 September 2013 |df=dmy-all }} On 25 July 2013, a promotional video of the song "Tera Rasta Main Chhodoon Na" was released.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KOdPt6MkpiY|title=Tera Rastaa Chhodoon Na Song Chennai Express|publisher=T-Series|date=25 July 2013|accessdate=30 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150220054854/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KOdPt6MkpiY|archivedate=20 February 2015|df=dmy-all}} The music album was launched on 1 July 2013.{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/in/album/chennai-express-original-motion/id668565016 |title=Chennai Express Music Album |publisher=[[Taran Adarsh]] |date=2 July 2013 |accessdate=3 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131015175412/https://itunes.apple.com/in/album/chennai-express-original-motion/id668565016 |archivedate=15 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }} {{tracklist | headline = Track list | extra_column = Singer(s) | total_length = 39:34 | title1 = 1 2 3 4 Get on the Dance Floor | extra1 = [[Vishal Dadlani]], [[Hamsika Iyer]], Sricharan | length1 = 3:48 | title2 = Titli | extra2 = [[Gopi Sunder]], [[Chinmayi]], [[Srimathumitha]] | length2 = 5:50 | title3 = Tera Rastaa Chhodoon Na | extra3 = [[Anusha Mani]], [[Amitabh Bhattacharya]] | length3 = 4:13 | title4 = Kashmir Main Tu Kanyakumari | extra4 = [[Sunidhi Chauhan]], [[Arijit Singh]], [[Neeti Mohan]] | length4 = 5:07 | title5 = Ready Steady Po | extra5 = [[Vishal Dadlani]], Brodha V, Smokey, Enkore, [[Natalie Di Luccio]] | length5 = 3:28 | title6 = Chennai Express | extra6 = [[S. P. Balasubrahmanyam]], [[Jonita Gandhi]] | length6 = 4:47 | title7 = Titli | note7 Dubstep version | extra7 = Zoheb Khan, Phoenyx | length7 = 3:40 | title8 = Chennai Express (Mashup) | extra8 = DJ Kiran Kamath | length8 = 3:37 | title9 = [[Lungi Dance]]| | extra9 = [[Yo Yo Honey Singh]] | length9 = 4:36 |all_writing=|title10=|length10=|title11=|length11=|title12=|length12=|title13=|length13=|title14=|length14=|title15=|length15=|title16=|length16=|title17=|length17=|title18=|length18=|title19=|length19=|title20=|length20=}} ===Critical response=== {{Album ratings|rev1 = Devesh Sharma ([[Filmfare]])|rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}}|rev2=[[IBN Live]]|rev2Score={{Rating|3.5|5}}|rev3=Yashika Mathur ([[Daily News and Analysis]])|rev3Score={{Rating|3.5|5}}|rev5=Joginder Tuteja ([[Rediff]])|rev5Score={{Rating|3|5}}}} The soundtrack album of ''Chennai Express'' received positive reviews. Devesh Sharma of ''[[Filmfare]]'' gave the album 4/5, saying that it is "a robust offering, which is full of new sounds and zany surprises", and that Vishal-Shekhar put in a lot of effort to bring out their best for the film.{{cite web |url=http://www.filmfare.com/reviews/music-review-chennai-express-3589.html |title=Music Review: Chennai Express |publisher=[[Filmfare]] |author=Devesh Sharma |date=3 July 2013 |accessdate=5 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130707004529/http://www.filmfare.com/reviews/music-review-chennai-express-3589.html |archivedate=7 July 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{Rating|4|5}} [[CNN-IBN|IBN Live]] gave the album 3.5/5 and stated that the album was another "winner" from Vishal-Shekhar. The composers were critically praised for blending different forms of music which "pepped" the otherwise usual Bollywood music.{{cite news |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/chennai-express-music-review-its-an-entertaining-allrounder/403936-45-76.html |title='Chennai Express' Music Review: It's an entertaining all-rounder |publisher=[[CNN-IBN]] |agency=[[Indo-Asian News Service|IANS]] |date=4 July 2013 |accessdate=5 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130707142252/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/chennai-express-music-review-its-an-entertaining-allrounder/403936-45-76.html |archivedate=7 July 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{Rating|3.5|5}} Yashika Mathur of ''[[Daily News and Analysis|DNA]]'' gave the album 3.5/5 and said that ''Chennai Express'' is "another winner from Vishal-Shekhar" that "boasts of a soothing bouquet of typical Bollywood numbers and some peppy tracks with exceptional mixing." She wrote that it "is likely to appeal to music lovers of all age-groups and sentiments" and called it "[a]n entertaining all-rounder, the composers must be applauded for fusing different music and beats to pep up the otherwise usual Bollywood music."{{cite news |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/1856900/review-music-review-chennai-express-chugs-on-experimentation |title=Music review: Chennai Express chugs on experimentation |agency=[[Indo-Asian News Service|IANS]] |author=Yashika Mathur |date=4 July 2013 |accessdate=5 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130706183845/http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/1856900/review-music-review-chennai-express-chugs-on-experimentation |archivedate=6 July 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{Rating|3.5|5}} Joginder Tuteja of [[Rediff.com]] gave the album 3/5 and wrote that the title song, "Chennai Express", is "just about average". He expressed his displeasure over Balasubramaniam's ill-suiting of voice for Shah Rukh Khan, and said that in all the song was not remarkable. He, however, complimented that the overall outcome was "satisfactory" with a few of the songs even standing out.{{cite web |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/music-review-chennai-express-has-some-aces-up-its-sleeve/20130704.htm%7Cpublisher= |title=Music review: Chennai Express has some aces up its sleeve |publisher=[[Rediff.com]] |author=Joginder Tuteja |date=4 July 2013 |accessdate=5 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131104101702/http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/music-review-chennai-express-has-some-aces-up-its-sleeve/20130704.htm%7Cpublisher= |archivedate=4 November 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{Rating|3|5}} Anand Holla of ''[[Mumbai Mirror]]'' said, "It's easy to imagine director Rohit Shetty's crystal clear brief to Vishal-Shekhar, involving words such as catchy, peppy, fun, and of course 'hit songs'. Given how happily formulaic the soundtrack has turned out, V–S have given us a fair idea of what awaits us this Eid."{{cite web |url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/entertainment/bollywood/Music-review-Chennai-Express/articleshow/20998952.cms |title=Music review: Chennai Express |publisher=[[Mumbai Mirror]] |author=Anand Holla |date=10 July 2013 |accessdate=11 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130715025852/http://www.mumbaimirror.com/entertainment/bollywood/Music-review-Chennai-Express/articleshow/20998952.cms |archivedate=15 July 2013 |df=dmy-all }} ==Release== The film had paid previews in India on 8 August 2013, with ten to twelve shows at multiplexes.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5936&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103154528/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5936&nCat=|archivedate=3 November 2013|date=8 August 2013|title=Chennai Express Paid Previews Draw Bumper Response at Multiplexes (Internet Archive)|publisher=Box Office India |accessdate=12 January 2015}} ''Chennai Express'' was scheduled to be released in non-traditional international markets. In Peru, it was the first Hindi film to be released on the same day as in India.{{cite news|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/latin-america-s-peru-hooked-on-to-bollywood-culture-with-pix-113090400398_1.html|title=Latin America's Peru hooked on to Bollywood culture|publisher=[[Business Standard]]|date=4 September 2013|agency=[[Press Trust of India|PTI]]|accessdate=29 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150129212951/http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/latin-america-s-peru-hooked-on-to-bollywood-culture-with-pix-113090400398_1.html|archivedate=29 January 2015|df=dmy-all}} ''Chennai Express'' was also released in Morocco, Germany, Switzerland, Austria, France, and Israel.{{cite news|title=Bollywood rides on Chennai Express to new international markets|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Bollywood-rides-on-Chennai-Express-to-new-international-markets/Article1-1102702.aspx|agency=[[Indo-Asian News Service]]|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|accessdate=3 August 2013|date=3 August 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130804073006/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Bollywood-rides-on-Chennai-Express-to-new-international-markets/Article1-1102702.aspx|archivedate=4 August 2013|df=dmy-all}} The price of tickets for ''Chennai Express'' was increased 40 percent above the usual tariff during the weekday shows and up to 20 percent on weekends; although this increase was not uniformly applied in all multiplexes.{{cite web|title=Shah Rukh's 'Chennai Express' turn costlier for cinemagoers|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-08-03/news-interviews/41032249_1_ticket-prices-chennai-express-rohit-shetty|author=Vickey Lalwani|work=[[The Times of India]]|accessdate=4 August 2013|date=3 August 2013}} The film was released in 2,550 cinemas across 3,550 screens in India,{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-08-14/box-office/41376007_1_crore-chennai-express-jawaani-hai-deewani|author=Meena Iyer|date=14 August 2013 |title='Chennai Express' breaks multiple records |work=[[The Times of India]] |accessdate=15 August 2013}} and across 700 screens internationally{{mdash}}including 196 screens in North America, 175 in the United Kingdom,{{cite news |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Shah-Rukh-Khan-starrer-Chennai-Express-to-get-biggest-Bollywood-release-in-UK/Article1-1101053.aspx |title=Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Chennai Express to get biggest Bollywood release in UK? |work=[[Hindustan Times]] |agency=[[Press Trust of India]] |date=31 July 2013 |accessdate=31 July 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130801052856/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Shah-Rukh-Khan-starrer-Chennai-Express-to-get-biggest-Bollywood-release-in-UK/Article1-1101053.aspx |archivedate=1 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }} 55 in the Middle East, and 30 in Australia{{mdash}}the widest Bollywood release up to that point.{{cite news|title=Movie preview: Fun ride on ''Chennai Express''|url=http://www.deccanherald.com/content/349516/movie-preview-fun-ride-chennai.html|accessdate=7 August 2013|newspaper=[[Deccan Herald]]|date=6 August 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130810055239/http://www.deccanherald.com/content/349516/movie-preview-fun-ride-chennai.html|archivedate=10 August 2013|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6116&nCat= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103154531/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6116&nCat= |archivedate=3 November 2013|title=Besharam To Have Second Widest Release of All Time|publisher=[[Box Office India]]|accessdate=3 October 2013|date=1 October 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6100&nCat= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029195111/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6100&nCat= |archivedate=2013-10-29|title=Top Screen Counts 2013|publisher=[[Box Office India]]|accessdate=3 October 2013|date=26 September 2013}} ===Marketing=== A first look of ''Chennai Express'' was released on 1 January 2013.{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/poster-of-chennai-express-shah-rukh-khan-rohit-shetty-deepika-padukone/1/240438.html|title=First Look: Ready Steady Po for Chennai Express!|work=[[India Today]]|date=2 January 2013|accessdate=2 January 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130102221820/http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/poster-of-chennai-express-shah-rukh-khan-rohit-shetty-deepika-padukone/1/240438.html|archivedate=2 January 2013|df=dmy-all}} A 31-second title track teaser, sung by S. P. Balasubrahmanyam, was released on 23 May 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.mumbaimirror.com/entertainment/bollywood/Salmans-voice-now-belongs-to-Shah-Rukh/articleshow/20236261.cms|title=Salman's voice now belongs to Shah Rukh|publisher=[[Mumbai Mirror]]|author=Mehul S Thakkar|date=24 May 2013|accessdate=24 May 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130608034806/http://www.mumbaimirror.com/entertainment/bollywood/Salmans-voice-now-belongs-to-Shah-Rukh/articleshow/20236261.cms|archivedate=8 June 2013|df=dmy-all}} The official trailer of the film was released at an event in Mumbai on 13 June 2013; two days after its launch it exceeded four million views on YouTube.{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/srk-and-deepika-launch-chennai-express-trailer-/1128704/|title=SRK and Deepika launch Chennai Express trailer!|work=[[The Indian Express]]|author=Sunitra Pacheco|date=13 June 2013|accessdate=15 June 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130616040512/http://www.indianexpress.com/news/srk-and-deepika-launch-chennai-express-trailer-/1128704|archivedate=16 June 2013|df=dmy-all}} The outfits worn by Khan and Padukone in the film were auctioned; proceeds from the sale were donated to a charity.{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/srk-deepikas-chennai-express-costumes-to-be-auctioned-for-charity/1147110/|title=SRK, Deepika's Chennai Express costumes to be auctioned for charity|work=The Indian Express|accessdate=18 December 2013|author=Apurva Singh|date=26 July 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131127211542/http://www.indianexpress.com/news/srk-deepikas-chennai-express-costumes-to-be-auctioned-for-charity/1147110|archivedate=27 November 2013|df=dmy-all}} The auction took place around the day of the film's release.{{cite web |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/srk-deepikas-outfits-in-chennai-express-to-be-auctioned/409254-8-66.html |title=Shah Rukh, Deepika Padukone's outfits in 'Chennai Express' to be auctioned |publisher=[[CNN-IBN]] |author=[[Indo-Asian News Service|IANS]] |date=25 July 2013 |accessdate=25 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130728122408/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/srk-deepikas-outfits-in-chennai-express-to-be-auctioned/409254-8-66.html |archivedate=28 July 2013 |df=dmy-all }} A [[Karaoke]] app developed by ''Singbox''{{mdash}}a Swedish gaming studio{{mdash}}was launched on 2 August 2013 for Android and iOS based smartphones.{{cite web|url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/news/2003703/Chennai-Express-Karaoke-App-for-Android|title=Chennai Express Karaoke app launched|date=6 August 2013|publisher=[[Bollywood Hungama]]|accessdate=27 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924144928/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/news/2003703/Chennai-Express-Karaoke-App-for-Android|archivedate=24 September 2015|df=dmy-all}} Khan promoted his film on the reality television shows ''[[Comedy Nights with Kapil]]'', ''[[Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah]], ''[[Madhubala Ek Ishq Ek Junoon]]'', ''[[Dance India Dance|DID Super Moms]]'', ''[[Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa (season 6)|Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 6]]'' and ''[[Indian Idol Junior]]''.{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/chennai-express-10-innovative-marketing-techniques-used-for-the-film/412778-8-66.html|title=Chennai Express: 10 innovative marketing techniques used for the film|publisher=IBN Live|date=8 August 2013|accessdate=27 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150330021516/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/chennai-express-10-innovative-marketing-techniques-used-for-the-film/412778-8-66.html|archivedate=30 March 2015|df=dmy-all}} [[Google Zeitgeist|The Zeitgeist]]{{mdash}}[[Google]]'s year-end compilation of the most frequent search queries{{mdash}}named ''Chennai Express'' the most trending topic of 2013 in India.{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/sunny-leone-most-searched-personality-on-google-in-2013/1209093/|title=Sunny Leone most searched personality on Google in 2013|agency=Press Trust of India|publisher=''The Indian Express''|accessdate=27 January 2015|date=18 December 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131222020458/http://www.indianexpress.com/news/sunny-leone-most-searched-personality-on-google-in-2013/1209093/|archivedate=22 December 2013|df=dmy-all}} The film's satellite television rights were sold to [[Zee Network]] for {{INRConvert|480|m|nolink=yes}}.{{cite news|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2013-08-01/news/40963081_1_satellite-rights-zee-entertainment-film-rights|title=Zee buys satellite rights of Chennai Express for its upcoming channel '& Pictures'|author=Nandini Raghavendra|date=1 August 2013|publisher=''[[The Economic Times]]''|accessdate=24 December 2013}} The agreement was linked to the film's box office revenue{{mdash}}the first deal of its kind in Indian cinema. If ''Chennai Express'' collected over {{INRConvert|1.3|b|nolink=yes}} net, then for every {{INR}}100 million earned after that, the producers would get an additional {{INR}}20 million. The film had its television premiere on 20 October 2013, and was seen by a record [[Gross rating point|number of viewers]], almost doubling that of the highest rated fiction show. It helped its broadcaster, [[Zee TV]], to reach the top position among General Entertainment Channels that month.{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-11-03/news/43611698_1_tvt-colors-amita-ka-amit|title=Chennai Express helps ZEE TV overtake Star Plus|author=Roshini Olivera|publisher=''The Times of India''|date=1 November 2013|accessdate=27 January 2015}} ===Legal issues=== Along with ''[[Once Upon ay Time in Mumbai Dobaara!]]'', ''Chennai Express'' was initially abandoned by Pakistani distributors and exhibitors because four [[Lollywood|Pakistani]] films were released on the same day.{{refn|The films were ‘[[Waar]]’, ‘[[Main Hoon Shahid Afridi]]’, ‘[[Ishq Khuda]]’ and ‘Josh’.}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/news/793988/shahrukh-akshay-shelved-in-pakistan|title=Shahrukh, Akshay shelved in Pakistan|publisher=[[DAWN (newspaper)|DAWN]]|date=24 April 2013|accessdate=29 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150419132653/http://www.dawn.com/news/793988/shahrukh-akshay-shelved-in-pakistan|archivedate=19 April 2015|df=dmy-all}} The release dates were postponed to 15 and 9 August, respectively.{{cite web |url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/pakistan-to-blackout-shah-rukhs-chennai-express-and-akshays-once-upon-a-time-in-mumbaai-2/1106549/ |title=Pakistan to blackout Shah Rukh's 'Chennai Express' and Akshay's 'Once Upon A Time in Mumbaai 2' |work=[[The Indian Express]] |date=23 April 2013 |accessdate=25 April 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130425234457/http://www.indianexpress.com/news/pakistan-to-blackout-shah-rukhs-chennai-express-and-akshays-once-upon-a-time-in-mumbaai-2/1106549 |archivedate=25 April 2013 |df=dmy-all }} During its Wai schedule of filming, the film's unit ran into trouble for using too much water from [[Dhom Dam]], in the drought-stricken [[Satara district]] of [[Maharashtra]]. The state's relief and rehabilitation minister, [[Patangrao Kadam]], addressed the problem.{{cite web |url=http://daily.bhaskar.com/news/ENT-vidya-balan-kareena-kapoor-asins-unknown-link-with-chennai-express-4301189-PHO.html?seq=14 |title=13 Interesting Facts you did not know about Chennai Express |work=[[Daily Bhaskar]] |accessdate=28 January 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150419135735/http://daily.bhaskar.com/news/ENT-vidya-balan-kareena-kapoor-asins-unknown-link-with-chennai-express-4301189-PHO.html?seq=14 |archivedate=19 April 2015 |df=dmy-all |date=2013-06-24 }} The film's poster and trailer, released on Twitter and YouTube, were criticised by some Tamil media for their depiction of Tamil ethos. They said Padukone's heavily accented dialogue resembled a Malayalee accent rather than a Tamil one.{{cite AV media |people= |year=2013 |title=Vivadha Medai |trans-title=The debate dais |medium=Television |language=Tamil |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yFGG8zZkGSs&list=WLo-RQ04tOAUUt9xAMVoM2R8YzX-WBtFzW |time= |publisher=SUN News |accessdate=17 December 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022075024/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yFGG8zZkGSs&list=WLo-RQ04tOAUUt9xAMVoM2R8YzX-WBtFzW |archivedate=22 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shah-rukh-khans-chennai-express-posters-spark-debate-much-ado-about-nothing/313646-8-66.html |title=Shah Rukh Khan's 'Chennai Express' posters spark debate; much ado about nothing? |publisher=[[CNN-IBN]] |date=3 January 2013 |accessdate=31 July 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131009232102/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/shah-rukh-khans-chennai-express-posters-spark-debate-much-ado-about-nothing/313646-8-66.html |archivedate=9 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }} Padukone defended the film, saying that it did not parody South Indian culture and that most of the crew, including herself, are South Indians. She later said, "Why would we spoof our own culture?"{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/not-spoofing-south-india-in-chennai-express-says-deepika-padukone/1/298317.html |title=Not spoofing South India in Chennai Express: Deepika Padukone : Bollywood, News |work=India Today |date=6 August 2013 |accessdate=15 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JwCFXjFR?url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/not-spoofing-south-india-in-chennai-express-says-deepika-padukone/1/298317.html |archivedate=27 September 2013 |df= }} On 31 July 2013, the [[Nationalist]] political party [[Maharashtra Navnirman Sena]]'s film wing threatened to disrupt the film's premiere; it reportedly attempted to dislodge ongoing popular Marathi movies from cinemas that show only one film at a time. The party was upset with reports that the distributors of ''Chennai Express'' had demanded prime slots in single screen cinemas, and at some multiplexes, where the superhit Marathi film ''[[Duniyadari]]'' had been popular since 19 July. On 1 August 2013, both the film directors, Rohit Shetty and Sanjay Jadhav were called on by [[Raj Thackeray]] to find a solution. After listening to both parties, Thackeray ruled that if ''Duniyadari'' was not removed from single screen cinemas across the state, then the MNS would not object to the release of ''Chennai Express'' in Maharashtra.{{cite news |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/raj-thackeray-gives-chennai-express-green-signal-after-meeting-rohit-shetty-400076 |title=Raj Thackeray gives Chennai Express green signal after meeting Rohit Shetty |publisher=[[NDTV]] |agency=[[Indo-Asian News Service]] |date=1 August 2013 |accessdate=2 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130802065833/http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/raj-thackeray-gives-chennai-express-green-signal-after-meeting-rohit-shetty-400076 |archivedate=2 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }} ''Chennai Express'' was released in 10 languages.{{cite web |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/chennai-express-will-be-released-in-ten-languages/story-20AD7zC1IyTPpjNKLtd1fN.html |title=Chennai Express will be released in ten languages |accessdate=2018-02-03 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180203181336/https://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/chennai-express-will-be-released-in-ten-languages/story-20AD7zC1IyTPpjNKLtd1fN.html |archivedate=3 February 2018 |df=dmy-all |date=2013-08-07 }} ==Critical reception== ''Chennai Express'' received mixed reviews from critics worldwide.{{cite web | url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/Shahrukh-Khans-Chennai-Express-getting-mixed-reviews/articleshow/21723573.cms? | title=Shahrukh Khan's Chennai Express getting mixed reviews | work=The Times of India | date=9 August 2013 | accessdate=30 January 2015}} ===India=== [[Taran Adarsh]] of ''[[Bollywood Hungama]]'' gave the movie 4 out of 5 stars and wrote, "On the whole, 'Chennai Express' has the trademark Rohit Shetty stamp all over. You seek entertainment, entertainment and entertainment in a film like 'Chennai Express' and the movie lives up to the hype and hoopla surrounding it."{{cite web |url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/moviemicro/criticreview/id/570145 |title=Chennai Express |publisher=[[Bollywood Hungama]] |author=[[Taran Adarsh]] |date=8 August 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130811213236/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/moviemicro/criticreview/id/570145 |archivedate=11 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{Rating|4|5}} Rachit Gupta of ''Filmfare'' rated the movie 4 of 5 stars, stating, "The film's peppered with humorous set pieces and colourful locales and songs. Rohit Shetty makes chettinad-style masala movies. And that's the perfect description of this film. If you don't plan to engage in a multi-lateral critique of dramatic elements and narrative, this film can be fun."{{cite web |url=http://www.filmfare.com/reviews/movie-review-chennai-express-3917.html |title=Movie Review: Chennai Express |publisher=[[Filmfare]] |author=Rachit Gupta |date=9 August 2013 |accessdate=9 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130810184007/http://www.filmfare.com/reviews/movie-review-chennai-express-3917.html |archivedate=10 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{Rating|4|5}} Sarita Tanwar Of ''[[Daily News and Analysis|DNA]]'' gave the movie 3.5 of 5 stars and said, "This is a treat for all Hindi film lovers. It has all the ingredients you'd expect from a big commercial masala film{{mdash}}big star cast, drama, action, comedy, songs, the car chases and the big finish, all delivered in Rohit Shetty's unapologetic ishtyle ... Overall, this is a bubblegum blockbuster."{{cite web |url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/1871888/review-movie-review-grab-a-bucket-of-popcorn-sit-back-and-enjoy-the-ride-as-chennai-express-is-here-to-entertain |title=Movie Review: Grab a bucket of popcorn, sit back and enjoy the ride as Chennai Express is here to entertain |publisher=''[[Daily News and Analysis]]'' |author=Sarita Tanwar |date=8 August 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130810184515/http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/1871888/review-movie-review-grab-a-bucket-of-popcorn-sit-back-and-enjoy-the-ride-as-chennai-express-is-here-to-entertain |archivedate=10 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{Rating|3.5|5}} Meena Iyer of ''[[Times of India]]'' gave the movie 3.5 of 5 stars, saying, "Chennai Express is a magnificently mounted film. In an ode to his own cinema{{mdash}}read Golmaal series or Bol Bachchan, Rohit Shetty, the director, who has grossers in Bollywood's 100-crore club, ups the scale for his Eid offering."{{cite web |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/hindi/Chennai-Express/movie-review/21705390.cms |title=Chennai Express |work=[[The Times of India]] |author=Meena Iyer |date=8 August 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130809070140/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/hindi/Chennai-Express/movie-review/21705390.cms |archivedate=9 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{Rating|3.5|5}} [[File:Deepika choli 1.jpg|thumb|upright|right|Padukone received largely positive response from critics.]] Saibal Chatterjee of ''[[NDTV]]'' gave the movie 3 of 5 stars and said that, "The whole-hearted zeal that SRK and Deepika bring to the table and the steady flow of funny one-liners serve Shetty's purpose well, turning Chennai Express into a full-on masala film that is completely unapologetic about its intentions. And that is its USP [Unique Selling Point]." ''[[Zee News]]'' rated the movie 3 of 5 stars, stating that if one ignores the platitudes, the absence of "punch" in the script and predictability, then the person is "onboard for a fun ride" with Chennai Express.{{cite web |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/aseem-chhabras-chennai-express-review-mindless-but-entertaining/20130809.htm |title='Chennai Express' review: This vehicle is worth being onboard for once! |publisher=[[Zee News]] |author=Resham Sengar |date=9 August 2013 |accessdate=9 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130811184158/http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/aseem-chhabras-chennai-express-review-mindless-but-entertaining/20130809.htm |archivedate=11 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }} ''[[India Today]]'' gave the film 3 stars: "The good news first. 'Chennai Express' is a pleasant and likeable film in parts. The bad news is, it does nothing for Shah Rukh Khan's imdomitable star power except to tell us he can still play a 40-year [old] Rahul without faltering."{{cite web |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/chennai-express-review-a-typical-sambar-and-sandalwood-creation/1/298716.html |title=Chennai Express review: A typical sambar-and-sandalwood creation |work=India Today |date=9 August 2013 |accessdate=26 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130825182555/http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/chennai-express-review-a-typical-sambar-and-sandalwood-creation/1/298716.html |archivedate=25 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }} Abhishek Gupta of ''[[India TV]]'' gave it 2.5 stars and wrote, "The comedy along with the action is rarely served with equal entertainment in today's cinema. We discern Rohit Shetty for his mass leisure which includes cars fluttering from the unknown corners and comedy which isn't slapstick but works."{{cite web |url=http://www.indiatvnews.com/entertainment/bollywood/chennai-express-movie-review-9125.html |title=Chennai Express movie review |publisher=[[India TV]] |date=8 August 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130811000638/http://www.indiatvnews.com/entertainment/bollywood/chennai-express-movie-review-9125.html |archivedate=11 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }} Shubhra Gupta of ''[[The Indian Express]]'' gave the movie 2.5 out of 5 stars, and wrote that the film comes up with some genuinely funny moments. She commended Padukone's looks, although she criticized aspects of her stagecraft skills.{{cite web |url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/review-chennai-express/1153040/2 |title=Review: Chennai Express |work=[[The Indian Express]] |author=Shubhra Gupta |date=9 August 2013 |accessdate=9 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130811002401/http://www.indianexpress.com/news/review-chennai-express/1153040/2 |archivedate=11 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }}{{Rating|2.5|5}} Sukanya Verma of ''Rediff.com'' gave the film 2.5 stars, saying, "Chennai Express evokes a few laughs but otherwise it decides to shift tracks from droll comedy to dreadful drama."{{cite web |url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/review-chennai-express-is-a-rollicking-trip-to-nowhere/20130809.htm |title=Review: Chennai Express is a rollicking trip to nowhere! |publisher=Rediff.com |author=Sukanya Verma |date=9 August 2013 |accessdate=26 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130824172051/http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/review-chennai-express-is-a-rollicking-trip-to-nowhere/20130809.htm |archivedate=24 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }} Khalid Mohamed of ''[[Deccan Chronicle]]'' gave the film 2.5 stars and wrote, "board Chennai Express at your own risk".{{cite web |url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/130809/entertainment-bollywood/article/chennai-express-review-board-your-own-risk |title='Chennai Express' review: Board at your own risk |work=Deccan Chronicle |accessdate=26 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131018034558/http://www.deccanchronicle.com/130809/entertainment-bollywood/article/chennai-express-review-board-your-own-risk |archivedate=18 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }} [[Rajeev Masand]] of ''[[CNN-IBN]]'' gave the film 2/5 rating and said the film was a "big, fat" bore. He commented that ''Chennai Express'' was a "bloated vanity project", and felt that the lead actor could have performed better.{{cite web |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/chennai-express-review-its-a-big-fat-bore-a-bloated-vanity-project-for-an-actor-capable-of-so-much-more/413121-47-84.html |title='Chennai Express' review: It's a big, fat bore. A bloated vanity project for an actor capable of so much more |publisher=IBNlive.in.com |date=16 August 2013 |accessdate=26 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130828035934/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/chennai-express-review-its-a-big-fat-bore-a-bloated-vanity-project-for-an-actor-capable-of-so-much-more/413121-47-84.html |archivedate=28 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }} [[Mayank Shekhar]] of ''[[Dainik Bhaskar]]'' rated it 1 star out of 5, saying, "You've paid for the ticket? Yes. Now just sit back and suffer."{{cite web |url=http://daily.bhaskar.com/article/ENT-movie-review-chennai-express-4343249-NOR.html |author=Mayank Shekhar |title=Movie Review: Chennai Express |publisher=Daily.bhaskar.com |date=9 August 2013 |accessdate=26 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130828022113/http://daily.bhaskar.com/article/ENT-movie-review-chennai-express-4343249-NOR.html |archivedate=28 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }} ===Overseas=== Rachel Saltz of ''[[The New York Times]]'' wrote, "'Chennai Express' feels like a sumptuous meal with carefully chosen wine and tasty appetizers but a botched main course. Money and visual care have been lavished on this Bollywood action-comedy-romance and glossy stars engaged (Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone). But the movie chugs along for most of its 2 hours and 20 minutes searching for comedy and characters in a frantically overplotted story."{{Cite news |url=https://movies.nytimes.com/2013/08/09/movies/chennai-express-with-the-bollywood-star-shah-rukh-khan.html?_r=0 |title=Taking the Fast Train to Win a Mob Princess |work=[[The New York Times]] |author=Rachel Saltz |date=8 August 2013 |accessdate=9 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130928092627/http://movies.nytimes.com/2013/08/09/movies/chennai-express-with-the-bollywood-star-shah-rukh-khan.html?_r=0 |archivedate=28 September 2013 |df=dmy-all }} Sneha May Francis of ''[[Emirates 24/7]]'' wrote, "Rohit Shetty's s(h)tyle of romance relies heavily on buffoonery and will be applauded mainly by Shah Rukh Khan loyalists". She added, "Rohit's carnival-like comedy coaxes some laughs, but can leave you exhausted." Sneha said that Padukone's performance "outshines" that of Khan.{{cite web|url=http://www.emirates247.com/entertainment/films-music/bollywood-review-deepika-padukone-outshines-srk-in-chennai-express-2013-08-08-1.517075|author=Sneha M. Francis|date=9 August 2013 |title=Bollywood review: Deepika Padukone outshines SRK in 'Chennai Express' |publisher=Emirates247.com |accessdate=26 August 2013}} Ronnie Scheib of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' wrote, "Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone are ill matched in this overworked comedy/romance/actioner ... Shetty's need to maintain his characters' romantic heroism constantly grates against his depictions of their ridiculousness."{{cite web |last=McNary |first=Dave |url=https://variety.com/2013/film/reviews/chennai-express-review-1200576716/ |title=Film Review: 'Chennai Express' |work=Variety |date=9 August 2013 |accessdate=26 August 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130817033122/http://variety.com/2013/film/reviews/chennai-express-review-1200576716/ |archivedate=17 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }} Simon Foster of the ''[[Special Broadcasting Service]]'' gave the film 2 stars out of 5 and described it as "a loud, lame-brained romantic comedy from the (very) broad directorial brush of Rohit Shetty, SRK's over-hyped vehicle sees the charismatic but ageing actor badly miscast and easily overshadowed by his leading lady, Deepika Padukone."{{cite web|url=http://www.sbs.com.au/films/movie/15566/chennai-express|author=Simon Foster|title=Bollywood blockbuster railroads logical storytelling|publisher=''[[Special Broadcasting Service]]''|date=8 August 2013|accessdate=26 August 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130824132452/http://www.sbs.com.au/films/movie/15566/Chennai-Express|archivedate=24 August 2013|df=dmy-all}} ==Box office== {{See also|List of highest-grossing Bollywood films}} At the time, ''Chennai Express'' became the highest-grossing Bollywood film, both in India and around the world, when it collected {{INRConvert|3.96|b|lk=r}}.{{cite web|title=Worldwide TOP TEN 2013|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6308&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140104212753/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6308&nCat=|archivedate=4 January 2014|publisher=[[Box Office India]]|date=12 December 2013|accessdate=20 December 2013}} It currently stands as the [[List of highest-grossing Bollywood films|eleventh -highest-grossing Bollywood film]] worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/Movies/movie_detail/chennai_express#.Uwy92uOSzz4|title=Chennai Express|publisher=Box Office India|accessdate=21 January 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150205040606/http://boxofficeindia.com/Movies/movie_detail/chennai_express#.Uwy92uOSzz4|archivedate=5 February 2015|df=dmy-all}} The film's gross broke the {{INRConvert|3.92|b|nolink=yes}} record set by ''[[3 Idiots]]'', according to Box Office India.{{cite web|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131204162443/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/youdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6269&nCat=|title=What Will Be The Final Worldwide Business Of Krrish 3 And What Was Chennai Express Worldwide?|url=http://boxofficeindia.com/youdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6269&nCat=|archivedate=4 December 2013 |publisher=Box Office India|accessdate=28 January 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5979&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131105220137/http://boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5979&nCat=|title=Chennai Express Crosses Ek Tha Tiger Worldwide In Ten Days|archivedate=5 November 2013|date=19 August 2013}} The film's final worldwide gross was {{INR}}423 [[crore]] ([[US$]]72.31 million).{{cite web|url=https://www.ofx.com/en-gb/forex-news/historical-exchange-rates/yearly-average-rates/|title=Yearly Average Rates (58.5 INR per USD)|publisher=[[OFX (company)|OFX]]|year=2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170713183556/https://www.ofx.com/en-gb/forex-news/historical-exchange-rates/yearly-average-rates/|archivedate=13 July 2017|df=dmy-all}} ===India=== During paid previews, ''Chennai Express'' performed well, with the Hindi version collecting {{INR}} 67.5 million, surpassing the previous record held by ''3 Idiots'', according to [[Box Office India]].{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5937&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103154624/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5937&nCat=|archivedate=3 November 2013|title=Chennai Express Has Huge Paid Previews|publisher=Box Office India|date=7 August 2013|accessdate=12 January 2015}} The film collected {{INR}} 292.5 million on its opening day, making it the second-highest opening day collection behind ''[[Ek Tha Tiger]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5938&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103154959/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5938&nCat=|archivedate=3 November 2013|title=Chennai Express Has Excellent Opening |publisher=Box Office India |date=9 August 2013 |accessdate=15 August 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/youdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5955&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103152630/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/youdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5955&nCat=|archivedate=3 November 2013|title= How Much Will Once Upon A Time In Mumbai Dobara Open With On Day One?|publisher=Box Office India |date=13 August 2012 |accessdate= 15 August 2013}} The film broke the second and third day box office records, collecting {{INRConvert|264.30|m|nolink=yes}},{{cite web|title=Chennai Express Second Day Territorial Breakdown – Box Office India|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5948&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103151112/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5948&nCat=|archivedate=3 November 2013|publisher=[[Box Office India]]|accessdate=18 September 2013}}{{cite web|title=All Time Highest Second Day Collections – Box Office India|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5947&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103151736/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5947&nCat=|archivedate=3 November 2013|publisher=[[Box Office India]]|accessdate=18 September 2013}} and {{INRConvert|292.10|m|nolink=yes}}, respectively, and collected {{INRConvert|870.8|m|nolink=yes}} ({{INRConvert|938.3|m|nolink=yes}} including paid previews),{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6246&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131121050923/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6246&nCat=|date=18 November 2013|archivedate=21 November 2013|title=Top Weekends 2013: Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram Leela 3rd|publisher=Boxofficeindia.com}} breaking the previous weekend record set by ''[[Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani]]''.{{cite web|title=All Time Top Opening Weekends: Chennai Express Leads By A Distance- Box Office India|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103152411/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5953&nCat=|date=12 August 2013|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=5953&nCat=|publisher=[[Box Office India]]|accessdate=18 September 2013|archivedate=3 November 2013 }}{{cite web|title=Top Weekends 2013: Grand Masti 4th – Box Office India|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103151914/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6069&nCat=|date=16 September 2013|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6069&nCat=|publisher=[[Box Office India]]|accessdate=18 September 2013|archivedate=3 November 2013 }} ''Chennai Express'' set another record for worldwide opening gross, earning {{INRConvert|1.59|b|nolink=yes}} in the three-day weekend.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6247&nCat=|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131122194114/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/boxnewsdetail.php?page=shownews&articleid=6247&nCat=|publisher=Box
